nodes.title: General site characteristics
nodes.body: Drankhor DoSbra ’khor rdo is located east of the dark-colored mesa known as Drankhor DoSbra ’khor rdo. This site is situated on the northern margin of the huge Sele PukSe le phug basin. The views in all directions but the east are constrained by higher topographical features. To the east one can see a great distance all the way across the Sele PukSe le phug basin to the Ngangla RingtsoNgang la ring mtsho basin. The terrain is sandy and gently slopes down towards he east. Drankhor DoSbra ’khor rdo consists of three in situ pillars.

nodes.title: Site elements
nodes.body:
The highly weathered pillars of Drankhor DoSbra ’khor rdo are mostly made of a dark gray volcanic (?) rock. The three standing specimens form a north-south line 2.4 m in length, which is oriented perpendicular to the axis of the slope. From south to north, hese three pillars have the following dimensions and characteristics:

  1. Long-stone DR1: irregularly shaped (50 cm [height] x 1 m [basal girth]).
  2. Long-stone DR2: irregularly shaped (60 cm x 1 m).
  3. Long-stone DR3: tabular (90 cm x 1 m). The broad sides of this pointed pillar are anomalously oriented east and west.

There are also two uprooted pillars at the site; a pinkish tabular specimen (90 cm long) and a partly submerged dark gray specimen (90 cm long).
